tit.e: Izuka-kofun Tumulus (an escallop-shaped keyhole-shaped mound in the latter half of the early Kofun period [Tumulus period])
tit.cmt: 用語をかえ、補足しました。
tit.e: Izuka-kofun Tumulus (an escallop-shaped keyhole-shaped mound in the latter half of the early Kofun period [Tumulus period])

sen.j: イヅカ古墳（いづかやまこふん）は古墳時代前期後半の纒向型といわれるホタテ貝型の前方後円墳であるが、現在は中世以降に全て削平されたその姿は確認できない。
sen.e: The Izuka Kofun (ancient tomb) is an escallop-shaped zenpokoenfun (large keyhole-shaped tomb) called Makimuku type kofun in the latter half of the early Kofun period, but now its existence cannot be confirmed because the site where it was was completely flattened after the Middle Ages.

The Izuka-kofun Tumulus is an escallop-shaped, large keyhole-shaped mound called Makimuku type tumulus in the latter half of the early Kofun period, but now its existence cannot be confirmed because the site was completely flattened after the Middle Ages.

The Izuka-kofun Tumulus is an escallop-shaped, large keyhole-shaped mound called Makimuku type tumulus in the latter half of the early Kofun period, but now its existence cannot be confirmed because the site was completely flattened after the Middle Ages.

sen.j: 纏向遺跡第119次調査の国道169号線バイパス建設に伴い発見。
sen.e: The tomb was discovered in the 119th research of the Makimuku Remains accompanied by the construction of a bypass of National Road Route 169.
The tumulus was discovered in the 119th research of the Makimuku-iseki Remains accompanied by the construction of a bypass of National Route 169.
The tumulus was discovered in the 119th research of the Makimuku-iseki Remains accompanied by the construction of a bypass of National Route 169.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 所在地：奈良県桜井市大字箸中字イヅカ山
sen.e: Location: Aza Izukayama, Oaza Hashinaka, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture
Location: Aza Izukayama, Oaza Hashinaka, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture
Location: Aza Izukayama, Oaza Hashinaka, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture
Buried person: Unknown
Buried person: Unknown
Buried person: Unknown

sen.j: 築造時期：古墳時代前期後半
sen.e: Time of construction: The latter half of the early Kofun period
Time of construction: The latter half of the early Kofun period
Time of construction: The latter half of the early Kofun period

sen.j: 墳 形：纒向型前方後円墳（埋没古墳・地中探査・電磁波測定をコンピューター解析した結果）
sen.e: Tomb shape: A Makimuku type zenpokoenfun (as the result of computer analyses of the buried kofun, underground research and electromagnetic wave measurement)
Tomb shape: A Makimuku type keyhole-shaped mound (as the result of computer analyses of the buried tumulus, underground research and electromagnetic wave measurement)
Tomb shape: A Makimuku type keyhole-shaped mound (as the result of computer analyses of the buried tumulus, underground research and electromagnetic wave measurement)

sen.j: 規 模：全長約80m・後円部径約50m、周濠幅約10m（但し全長に関して100mを超える可能性もある）
sen.e: Size: About 80 meters in full length, the back circular part about 58 meters in diameter, the shugo (loop-moat) about 10 meters in width (however, the full length could be more than 100 meters)

Size: Approximately 80 meters in full length, the back circular part approximately 50 meters in diameter, the shugo (surrounding moat) approximately 10 meters in width (however, the full length could be more than 100 meters)
sen.cmt: 数値修正し、用語を変えました。
sen.e: Size: Approximately 80 meters in full length, the back circular part approximately 50 meters in diameter, the shugo (surrounding moat) approximately 10 meters in width (however, the full length could be more than 100 meters)

sen.j: 埋葬部：削平された状態のため不明。
sen.e: Burial spot: Unknown because of the flattened site
Burial spot: Unknown because of the flattened site
Burial spot: Unknown because of the flattened site

sen.j: 出土遺物：周濠内跡より古墳時代前期（II期）の遺物出土。
sen.e: Unearthed goods: Relics in the early Kofun period (stage II) from the remains of the shugo.
Unearthed goods: Relics in the early Kofun period (stage II) from the remains of the shugo.
Unearthed goods: Relics in the early Kofun period (stage II) from the remains of the shugo.
